dsDescriptionValue.value:
The Maricopa Regional Household Travel Survey, 2002, conducted by NuStats, in collaboration with the Maricopa Association of Governments (MAG), was initiated to assess the travel patterns of households in the metropolitan region of Phoenix, Arizona. This collection contains data for 4,018 households in Maricopa County, and a small portion of Pinal County. Household recruitment for
the study was conducted through the use of a "recruitment interview", in which respondents were informed of the survey, its purpose, and the obligation of all household members to complete the survey.  Information regarding the household and its members was also collected during the recruitment interview.  Participating households were assigned a specific "travel period" or 48-hour period on which to record their travel and activities, including mode of transportation, trip purpose, number of vehicle passengers, departure and arrival times, ride fare, and parking costs. Demographic information for this study includes age, gender, ethnicity, language, disability, education level, occupation, and household income.

The purpose of a household travel survey is to obtain information related to travel behavior.  This includes information on average vehicle occupancy, trip generation, trip distribution, and modal choice.

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Households within the metropolitan area of Phoenix, Arizona.

fields.value: For information on sampling, please see the "Sample Design and Performance" section of the Final Report documentation included with this release.
For information on weights, please see the "Weighting and Expansion" section of the Final Report documentation included with this release.
The recruitment rate for this study was 42 percent, the retrieval rate was 73 percent, and the overall response rate was 31 percent (42 percent * 73 percent).
